channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft plans to invest $3B in AI, cloud in India
item.description: Microsoft plans to invest $3 billion to expand its artificial intelligence and cloud services in India. The firm, which has been operating in India fo...

item.title: Does Dry January Really Make People Healthier?
item.description: Abstaining from alcohol can have immediate benefits. But lasting gains require lasting change.

item.title: Apple to label notification summaries to indicate use of AI
item.description: Apple said on Monday it would release an update to better indicate that its notification summaries are generated by artificial intelligence. “A softwa...

item.title: Europe Wanted to Lead the World on EVs. Its Carmakers Can’t Keep Up
item.description: The lack of cheap EVs and the reliance on combustion engines is putting Europe’s plan to ban new petrol cars by 2035 at risk.

item.title: Satellites Can Now Identify Methane ‘Super-Emitters’
item.description: Two eyes in the sky are now trained on Earth, locating the worst offenders for releasing methane, wherever they may be.

item.title: May Mobility reveals electric autonomous minibus at CES 2025
item.description: May Mobility, an autonomous vehicle technology startup, unveiled at CES 2025 the next vehicle in its portfolio: an electric, autonomous minibus made i...

item.title: 10 More of the Coolest Things We’ve Seen at CES 2025
item.description: More of the wild ideas and clever innovations we’re seeing this week at tech’s big show in Las Vegas.

item.title: Just Eat Takeaway completes Grubhub sale to Wonder for a modest $650M
item.description: After looking for a buyer for more than two years, Just Eat Takeaway.com has finally closed the menu on Grubhub. On Tuesday, the Dutch food delivery g...

item.title: Correcting Genetic Spelling Errors With Next-Generation Crispr
item.description: Treatments for rare diseases are hard to create and expensive to deliver, but there is new hope for editing the software of the genome.

item.title: NXP to buy automotive safety software firm TTTech Auto for $625M
item.description: Dutch semiconductor giant NXP on Tuesday said it plans to acquire TTTech Auto, an Austrian company specializing in safety software for autonomous vehi...
